content.heading: HTML vs XHTML
paragraphs: XHTML is a stricter, XML-based version of HTML for better structure and compatibility.

content.heading: What is XHTML?
paragraphs: XHTML (EXtensible HyperText Markup Language) follows XML syntax, ensuring well-formed markup and integration with XML applications.

content.heading: Why XHTML?
paragraphs: XHTML enforces strict rules for extensibility, error handling, and compatibility with data formats.

content.heading: Key Differences from HTML
paragraphs: - Proper nesting and closing of elements
